phases.name: Definition & Design Sprint (COMPRESSED)
phases.label: üö® CRITICAL PATH - Must complete by Dec 31, 2025
phases.objective: Emergency consolidation of Phase 1 and 2 activities. Rapid materiality assessment, control identification, GRC platform selection, and emergency board approval within 6-8 weeks.

keyActivities.name: WEEK 1: Emergency Board Workshop
keyActivities.description: Secure immediate executive sponsorship and board approval
subTasks: Emergency board presentation on P29 urgency and timeline risks
Secure CEO/CFO sponsorship within 48 hours
Obtain emergency budget approval (¬£300K-500K for accelerated implementation)
Approve use of external consultants to compress timeline

keyActivities.name: WEEKS 1-2: Rapid Materiality & Control Identification
keyActivities.description: Fast-track control inventory using consultant-led workshops
subTasks: Leverage existing risk register (no redesign)
Use industry benchmarks to identify 30-50 material controls quickly
Skip bottom-up process mapping (high risk but necessary time-saving)
Focus only on financial reporting and highest-risk operational controls

keyActivities.name: WEEKS 2-3: GRC Platform Emergency Selection
keyActivities.description: Accelerated vendor selection from pre-vetted shortlist
subTasks: Use pre-qualified vendor shortlist (ReadiNow, ServiceNow, SAP, MetricStream)
Single-day vendor demos (not full RFP process)
Select platform with fastest implementation time (not 'best fit')
Sign contract by Week 3 with expedited implementation clause

keyActivities.name: WEEKS 3-6: Compressed Control Documentation
keyActivities.description: Rapid control definition and ownership assignment
subTasks: Use standardised templates (no customisation)
Document 'who, what, how often' for each control (minimal detail)
Assign control owners and secure acceptance
Accept lower documentation quality initially (remediate in Q1 2026)

keyActivities.name: WEEKS 6-8: Minimal Viable Assurance Plan
subTasks: Define pass/fail criteria for top 20 controls only
Create simplified testing protocols
Deploy manual controls for Q1 2026 (GRC platform won't be ready)
Train control owners on self-assessment approach

deliverables.name: Q1 2026 Manual Control Plan
deliverables.description: Interim controls until platform is live

compressionRisks: Incomplete control identification (material gaps may exist)
GRC platform selection based on speed not fit
No time for dry run or pilot testing
whatToSkip: Full RFP process for GRC platform

phases.name: Accelerated Assurance (COMPRESSED)
phases.label: ‚ö†Ô∏è HIGH RISK - Reduced assurance coverage
phases.objective: Rapid-cycle testing of highest-risk controls only. Minimal dry run during live compliance period (risky but unavoidable). Establish board reporting mechanism.

keyActivities.name: WEEK 1: GRC Platform Go-Live (Partial)
subTasks: Deploy GRC platform with basic workflows only
Migrate top 30 controls to platform (leave others manual)
Accept bugs and incomplete features initially
Plan iterative improvements throughout Q1-Q2 2026

keyActivities.name: WEEKS 1-2: High-Risk Control Testing
subTasks: Focus on financial reporting controls (CFO priority)
Use sampling (not continuous monitoring initially)
Accept higher detection risk
Document deficiencies for Q2 remediation

keyActivities.name: WEEKS 2-3: Board Dashboard Creation
subTasks: Create simple dashboard (not 'Approach on a Page' initially)
Focus on control status and deficiencies only
Present to Audit Committee with caveat on limited assurance
Set expectation of likely qualification in 2027 report

keyActivities.name: WEEK 4: Dry Run (Limited Scope)
keyActivities.description: Concurrent with live compliance period (HIGH RISK)
subTasks: Test controls while also collecting live evidence (not ideal)
Identify immediate deficiencies and remediate in real-time
Accept that this is 'learning by doing' approach
Document lessons learned for Q2-Q4 improvements

compressionRisks: GRC platform deployed with incomplete configuration
Testing only covers 60-70% of material controls in Q1
No proper dry run before live period (learning on the job)
High likelihood of control failures in Q1-Q2 2026
whatToSkip: Testing of medium/low-risk controls in Q1
Separate dry run period (combined with live testing)
Three lines of defence RACI refinement

phases.name: Ongoing Monitoring & Remediation
phases.label: Compliance Period - Full-year evidence collection
phases.objective: Execute full-year control testing, evidence collection, deficiency remediation, and prepare for March 2027 declaration (likely qualified).

keyActivities.name: Q1-Q2 2026: Catch-Up and Expansion
keyActivities.description: Expand control coverage and remediate Q1 findings
subTasks: Bring remaining controls into GRC platform
Test medium-risk controls that were skipped in January
Remediate deficiencies identified in January
Improve board dashboard with additional metrics

keyActivities.name: Q2-Q4 2026: Continuous Monitoring
subTasks: Execute control testing per defined frequency
Collect evidence for annual declaration
Monitor and report deficiencies to board quarterly
Conduct internal audit reviews

keyActivities.name: Q4 2026: Declaration Preparation
subTasks: Assess overall control effectiveness for FY 2026
Determine declaration outcome (likely qualified)
Prepare disclosure language with legal/audit support
Present recommendation to board in Q4 2026

keyActivities.name: Ongoing: Platform Optimisation
subTasks: Add automation and continuous monitoring
Enhance dashboards and reporting
Train additional users
Integrate with other systems

deliverables.name: FY 2026 Evidence Repository
deliverables.description: Complete evidence for all material controls

compressionRisks: Deficiencies discovered throughout 2026 may not be remediable in time
Control testing may reveal material weaknesses requiring disclosure
Board and audit committee confidence may be lower
Higher likelihood of qualified declaration in March 2027
Increased external audit scrutiny and potential additional audit fees
whatToSkip: None - this is the live compliance period
